brief_summary.textblock:
Rationale:  Surgery remains the standard of care for stage 1 (T1-2a N0)non-small cell lung
      cancer. Stereotactic body radiation therapy is a newer radiation treatment that gives fewer
      but higher and possibly more effective doses of radiation than standard radiation.  This
      technique may be able to send x-rays directly to the tumor and cause less damage to normal
      tissue. It is not yet known whether stereotactic body radiation therapy is more effective
      than surgery in treating non-small cell lung cancer.

      Purpose:  The primary aim of this randomized phase II trial is to determine if the efficacy
      of SBRT is comparable to that of standard surgical interventions for patients with T1N0
      non-small cell lung cancer.
